perturbation.original_text:
Sponsor must obtain, and continuously maintain, at its own expense, the following insurance policies:
     1. Workers' Compensation in compliance with California's laws, including Employers' Liability with minimum limits of:   $ *** Each Accident; $ *** Disease - Each Employee; $ *** Disease - Policy Limit.

  2. An Insurance Services Office occurrence based Commercial General Liability Insurance Policy, including contractual liability and products/completed operations liability coverage with minimum limits of:

$ *** Each Occurrence; $ *** General Aggregate; $ *** Products/Completed Operations Aggregate.

All insurance policies must be issued by an admitted insurance carrier with an A.M. Best rating of A-8 or better. SDBF, Padres LP, the City of San Diego and each of their subsidiary or affiliated companies and its and their directors, officers and employees must be named  as Additional Insureds under the Commercial General Liability, Automobile Liability  and Umbrella Liability Policies. All of these policies must contain Cross Liability Endorsements, or their equivalent. Further, coverage for the Additional Insureds shall apply on a primary basis irrespective of any other insurance, whether collectible or not. All policies shall be endorsed to provide a Waiver of Subrogation in favor of SDBF. In the event of cancellation, non-renewal or material modification SDBF shall receive thirty (30) days written notice thereof. Sponsor shall provide SDBF with certificates of insurance evidencing compliance with all insurance provisions noted above prior to the commencement of the sponsorship and annually prior to the expiration of each required insurance policy.
perturbation.changed_text: Sponsor must obtain and maintain insurance policies. All insurance policies must be issued by an admitted insurance carrier with an A.M. Best rating of A-8 or better. SDBF, Padres LP, the City of San Diego and each of their subsidiary or affiliated companies and its and their directors, officers and employees must be named as Additional Insureds under the Commercial General Liability, Automobile Liability and Umbrella Liability Policies. In the event of cancellation, non-renewal or material modification SDBF shall receive thirty (30) days written notice thereof. Sponsor shall provide SDBF with certificates of insurance evidencing compliance with all insurance provisions noted above prior to the commencement of the sponsorship.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of specific insurance requirements such as Workers' Compensation, Employers' Liability, Commercial General Liability, including the minimum coverage limits, significantly weakens the insurance obligation. Additionally, deleting the annual submission of insurance certificates eliminates a key compliance verification step. This omission creates a legal contradiction because California law mandates specific insurance coverage types and minimum limits for businesses depending on their activities and number of employees. The contract, as modified, would not guarantee compliance with these minimums.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Labor Code Section 3700 (Workers' Compensation Insurance), California Insurance Code Section 11580.2 (Uninsured Motorist Coverage), and relevant California Business and Professions Code sections related to liability insurance for businesses.

perturbation.original_text: Compliance with Rules, Regulations and Policies; Conduct. All use by Sponsor and Sponsor's invitees of any hospitality benefits granted hereunder shall be subject to the rules, regulations and policies established from time to time by SDBF and/or the Padres and may be revoked in the event of the failure of Sponsor or Sponsor's invitees to comply with such rules, regulations and policies. At the request of SDBF,  Sponsor will enter into SDBF's standard-form Founders Club Agreements with respect to any Founders Club or premium seating benefits furnished hereunder. With respect to any hospitality benefits granted hereunder, Sponsor and Sponsor's invitees shall maintain proper decorum, comply with all laws, rules and regulations of all governmental authorities, not suffer or permit the continuation of any use or manner of use of the hospitality benefits in violation of any applicable Founders Club Agreements, not create any nuisance, and not take any action which either diminishes hazard insurance coverage for the Ballpark or increases the premium payable for such insurance. Sponsor and Sponsor's invitees shall be bound by and observe the terms and conditions upon which any admission tickets are issued or sold.
perturbation.changed_text: Compliance with Rules, Regulations and Policies; Conduct. All use by Sponsor and Sponsor's invitees of any hospitality benefits granted hereunder shall be subject to the rules, regulations and policies established from time to time by SDBF and/or the Padres and may be revoked in the event of the failure of Sponsor or Sponsor's invitees to comply with such rules, regulations and policies. At the request of SDBF,  Sponsor will enter into SDBF's standard-form Founders Club Agreements with respect to any Founders Club or premium seating benefits furnished hereunder. Sponsor and Sponsor's invitees shall maintain proper decorum, not create any nuisance.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause "comply with all laws, rules and regulations of all governmental authorities" allows the sponsor and its invitees not to comply with the law. If this happened, it would create a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: This omission violates California Penal Code and municipal codes that apply to behavior in public places, including but not limited to laws against public intoxication, disorderly conduct, and health and safety regulations.

perturbation.original_text: Limitation on Damages. The parties agree that neither party shall be liable for, and in no event whatsoever shall damages or other award based on this Agreement or the performance or failure to perform any provision hereof include, any recovery for loss-of-profits, loss-of-business, special, indirect, consequential or punitive damages.
perturbation.changed_text: Limitation on Damages. The parties agree that neither party shall be liable for, and in no event whatsoever shall damages or other award based on this Agreement or the performance or failure to perform any provision hereof include, any recovery for punitive damages.
perturbation.explanation: California law recognizes that in cases of fraud, malice, or oppression, punitive damages may be awarded to punish the wrongdoer and deter similar conduct. By removing the ability to recover for loss-of-profits, loss-of-business, special, indirect, consequential, the contract severely limits the injured party's ability to be made whole and to be justly compensated for the harm suffered as a result of a breach, violating California law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code Section 3294 (allowing punitive damages in cases of oppression, fraud, or malice), and California contract law principles requiring fair and reasonable compensation for breach of contract.
